name: Transform data with Azure Synapse serverless SQL pools using CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE AS SELECT statement

folder.name: Use Azure Synapse serverless SQL pools for transforming the data in the lake

content.query:
/*
Transform data with Azure Synapse serverless SQL pools 
    using CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE AS SELECT statement
*/

--CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE AS SELECT in serverless SQL pool

-- you might need to execute following statement if you never did so on current database
-- CREATE MASTER KEY

CREATE DATABASE SCOPED CREDENTIAL destination_credential
WITH IDENTITY='SHARED ACCESS SIGNATURE',  
	SECRET = 'EaYx70WEuj95gKTgHAOauwucqY9zxvhRG+BdKmTjWVjnPPlFhuc3dW+ncaNHesncd8xHJbtP9ogzRYpEG+t1fQ==' -- fill in your SAS key that will be used for CETAS destination
GO

CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE destination_ds
WITH
(    
	LOCATION         = 'https://<storage>.<dfs>.core.windows.net/<container>' -- replace path to match root path for your CETAS destination
     , CREDENTIAL = destination_credential
)
GO

CREATE EXTERNAL FILE FORMAT parquet_file_format
WITH
(  
    FORMAT_TYPE = PARQUET,
    DATA_COMPRESSION = 'org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.SnappyCodec'
)
GO

-- use CETAS to export select statement with OPENROWSET result to  storage
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE aggregated_data
WITH (
    LOCATION = 'aggregated_data/',
    DATA_SOURCE = destination_ds,  
    FILE_FORMAT = parquet_file_format
)  
AS
SELECT decennialTime, stateName, SUM(population) AS population
FROM
    OPENROWSET(BULK 'https://azureopendatastorage.blob.core.windows.net/censusdatacontainer/release/us_population_county/year=*/*.parquet',
    FORMAT='PARQUET') AS [r]
GROUP BY decennialTime, stateName
GO

-- you can query the newly created external table
SELECT * FROM aggregated_data
